SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.manager

Class CollisionManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.manager.CollisionManager
public class CollisionManager extends Object
The CollisionManager class is responsible for handling collisions between various actors in the game. It follows the singleton pattern to ensure only one instance is created. The class manages collision detection and processing, including handling user projectiles, enemy projectiles, and player collisions with enemies. It also integrates with the AudioManager for sound effects and the ActorManager for managing game actors.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Managing collision handlers and processing collisions between different types of actors.
  • Calculating shrunken bounds for collision detection to provide a more accurate collision area.
  • Handling the effects of collisions, such as applying damage, creating explosions, and playing sound effects.

  • Constructor Details

    • CollisionManager

      private CollisionManager()
      Private constructor for the CollisionManager class. Initializes the CollisionManager instance and sets up the AudioManager. This constructor is private to enforce the singleton pattern.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static CollisionManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the CollisionManager. This method is synchronized to ensure thread safety. If the instance is null, it initializes a new CollisionManager.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of CollisionManager

    • setCollisionHandler

      public void setCollisionHandler(CollisionHandler handler)
      Sets the collision handler for managing collision events.
      Parameters:
      handler - the CollisionHandler to be set

    • handleAllCollisions

      public void handleAllCollisions(ActorManager actorManager)
      Handles all types of collisions in the game. This method processes the following collision scenarios: 1. User projectiles hitting all enemies (including bosses). 2. Enemy projectiles hitting players. 3. Boss projectiles hitting players. 4. Players colliding with all enemies (including bosses).
      Parameters:
      actorManager - The ActorManager instance containing all actors in the game.

    • getShrunkenBounds

      private javafx.geometry.Bounds getShrunkenBounds(ActiveActor actor)
      Calculates and returns the shrunken bounds of the given actor. The bounds are shrunk by a percentage defined by the shrinkPercentage field.
      Parameters:
      actor - the ActiveActor whose bounds are to be shrunken
      Returns:
      a BoundingBox representing the shrunken bounds of the actor

    • handleCollisions

      private void handleCollisions(List<? extends ActiveActor> sourceActors, List<? extends ActiveActor> targetActors)
      Handles collisions between two lists of active actors. This method takes two lists of active actors, `sourceActors` and `targetActors`, and checks for collisions between each pair of actors from the two lists. If a collision is detected, it processes the collision.
      Parameters:
      sourceActors - the list of source active actors to check for collisions
      targetActors - the list of target active actors to check for collisions

    • processCollision

      private void processCollision(CollisionManager.CollisionPair pair)
      Processes a collision between two active actors.
      Parameters:
      pair - The collision pair containing the source and target actors.

    • createExplosionAt

      private void createExplosionAt(ActiveActor target)
      Creates an explosion effect at the location of the specified target actor. This method calculates the explosion coordinates based on the target's layout and translation properties, then creates an ExplosionEffect at those coordinates. The explosion effect is added to the UI and a sound effect is played. The collision handler is notified when the explosion starts and finishes.
      Parameters:
      target - the ActiveActor at whose location the explosion will be created
